stem: Which of the following feature is seen in tuberculosis arthritis?
opt3: Mycobacteria are not found in synovial fluid
opt4: Systemic symptoms occur in a majority of patients
disc:
Tuberculous arthritis commonly involves hip and knee joints. Usually, it's monoarticular. Clinical features include swelling and pain, but other features of acute inflammation are usually absent. Presentation is often late and joint destruction has already started. Systemic symptoms are seen only in 30% of the patients.

Diagnosis is by synovial biopsy. The synovial fluid analysis is usually nonspecific.
